intro: Hieracium maculatum var. funerum, commonly known as the funeral dandelion, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and open habitats, such as roadsides and meadows. Its leaves are deeply lobed and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a distinctive purple center. It is often found in association with other weeds and is considered a common plant in temperate regions.
